item.title: Bird's Eye View Explorer: A Network Perspective
item.dc:creator: brawlaphant
item.description:
Right now we have arbiscan for onchain visibility and arbitrum website for project visibility, but imagine every arbitrum project as blobs next to every other by the size of their activity with the ability to zoom in and out of any area from the whole. I think this would provide a very cool visual for new entrants and arb daoists.

Not a dev,(yet) but in time I would create this. Maybe others can pull this off, here is a simple explanation of the design concept:

Building the Visualization

Data Collection and Preparation:
Collect Data: Use Arbitrum’s APIs or blockchain explorers to extract data on transactions, smart contracts, and interactions between them. Focus on identifying projects and their interactions.
Prepare Data: Process the data to highlight relationships between projects. This might involve mapping transactions to the projects initiating or receiving them and identifying smart contracts that facilitate these interactions.

Network Analysis:
Create a Graph Model: Treat each project as a node and each interaction (transactions, smart contract calls) as edges between these nodes. Use attributes to represent the volume or significance of the interactions.
Analyze the Network: Use network analysis techniques to identify key projects (nodes with high connectivity), clusters of closely interacting projects, and the overall structure of the network.

Visualization:
Choose a Visualization Tool: Options include graph visualization tools like Gephi, web-based libraries like D3.js, or programming libraries like NetworkX in Python.
Design the Visualization: Represent the Arbitrum blockchain’s project ecosystem as a network diagram where nodes represent projects, and edges represent interactions. Customize node sizes and edge thicknesses based on metrics like transaction volume or interaction frequency. Use color coding to differentiate types of projects or activity levels.

Interactive Features:
Implement Interactivity: Allow users to zoom in/out, click on nodes to get more information about projects, and filter by types of interactions or projects.
Dynamic Updates: If possible, make the visualization dynamically update with new transactions and interactions to keep the overview current.

Thanks for reading

item.title: Thetanuts Finance Bi-Weekly Update (29 March 2024)
item.dc:creator: Thetanuts_Finance
item.description:
Recap of the Previous Two Weeks

In December 2023, Thetanuts Finance saw the launch of its v3 Upgrade – entailing a major architecture revamp and brand new Trading Interface, where users could go long or short on on-chain options. While Thetanuts Finance is a multi-chain protocol, Arbitrum network is the only instance where Thetanuts Finance v3 is integrated.

Thetanuts Finance began distributing $ARB rewards from Arbitrum STIP on January 29, where 200,000 $ARB was distributed equally over 8 weeks. Arbitrum STIP rewards will end on March 29.

Below, we recap on the growth of our metrics on Arbitrum at each key milestone. These metrics can also be verified on our Dune dashboard.

Date TVL($) Lifetime Trading Volume on Arbitrum ($)
v3 Upgrade Launch (13 Dec 2023) Total: $10.5mm, Arbitrum: $75k -
Start of ARB STIP (29 Jan 2024) Total: $11.3mm, Arbitrum: $1.6mm $5.6mm
End of ARB STIP(29 Mar 2024) Total: $32.7mm, Arbitrum: $7.8mm $32.7mm

Based on the exponential growth across all of our core metrics, we believe that the Thetanuts Finance v3 deployment on Arbitrum has been largely successful – largely empowered by $ARB rewards that we were able to distribute from Arbitrum STIP.

Roadmap on Arbitrum

With Arbitrum DAO’s “Double Down on STIP Successes” (“Arbitrum STIP Bridge”) proposal likely to be successful, Thetanuts Finance expects to be eligible for an additional 200,000 $ARB – which will be fully used to further incentivize users on Arbitrum.

Thetanuts Finance recently launched a Leveraged LRT Strategy Vault – which uses Pendle + EtherFi’s $PT-eETH, allowing them to generate further yields from option premiums. While these products will first be on Ethereum Mainnet, we intend to integrate them onto Arbitrum shortly – and to incentivize them using Arbitrum STIP Bridge rewards.

The roadmap for the Leveraged LRT Strategy Vault includes asset coverage of other leading LRTs on Pendle – including $pufETH, $ezETH, $rsETH, and $swETH. We also intend to integrate other ETH-related assets on Pendle such as Ethena’s $USDe.

Prior Governance Submissions to Arbitrum DAO

Our previous governance submissions to Arbitrum DAO for Arbitrum STIP can be found below.
